abstract: Facebook’s chief executive and a founder, Mark Zuckerberg, has agreed to donate $100 million to improve the long-troubled public schools in Newark.
snippet: Facebook’s chief executive and a founder, Mark Zuckerberg, has agreed to donate $100 million to improve the long-troubled public schools in Newark.
lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive and a founder of Facebook, has agreed to donate $100 million to improve the long-troubled public schools in Newark, and Gov. Chris Christie will cede some control of the state-run system to Mayor Cory A. Booker in conjunction with the huge gift, The New York Times’s Richard Perez-Pena reports.

headline.main: Zuckerberg Gives $100 Million for Newark Schools
